required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing 30mL Single Versus 80mL Double Balloon Catheters for Pre-induction Cervical Ripening
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial: Comparing 30mL Single Versus 80mL Double Balloon Catheters for Pre-induction Cervical Ripening

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to perform a randomized controlled trial to compare the efficacy of 80mL double balloon catheter versus a 30mL single catheter balloon for pre-induction cervical ripening by evaluating the change in Bishop score.

primary_outcome.measure: Bishop score greater than or equal to 6 at time of balloon catheter removal

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: vaginal delivery time less than 24 hours from initiation of induction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participants infant will be monitored from immediately to 5 minutes after birth
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Artificial rupture of membranes required to augment labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)
The participant will be monitored from time of admission until delivery, an expected average of 24-48 hours of the infant (on average 24-48 hours)

intervention.description: The balloon catheters have been used to provide mechanical dilation to the cervix as a method of pre-induction cervical ripening.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Bishop score of 5 or less
- Singleton
- Cephalic presentation
- Fewer than 4 contractions in 10 minutes
- Reactive fetal monitoring
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-vertex presentation
- Placenta previa
- Vasa previa
- Unexplained vaginal bleeding
- Active herpes simplex virus infection
- Non-English speaking
- Previous attempt at an induction of labor in the current pregnancy
- Prolapsed umbilical cord
- More than one prior cesarean delivery or history of classical cesarean delivery
- Patients receiving or planning to undergo exogenous prostaglandin administration as the primary induction agent
